text: I wrote a blog post to summarise the lessons learned with the crazy discussion in <#C67910KEH|general> about getting the only element of an array: <https://giordano.github.io/blog/2021-03-25-access-array/> feedback welcome! :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.title: What you can learn from accessing an element of an array in Julia
attachments.text: This innocent question in the official Slack workspace of the Julia programming language How can I extract the Float64 element from a 1x1 Array{Float64, 1}? spurred a series of more or less serious answers: use the only function: only(a) get the element with index 1: a[1] omit all indices: a[]...
attachments.fallback: What you can learn from accessing an element of an array in Julia
